Instruction: Combine 1/2 cup of softened butter with 1/2 cup of brown sugar in a medium bowl and mix until smooth. Add 1 1/2 cups of flour and combine to form the crust. Press firmly into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking pan.
Bake until the crust turns golden, approximately 15 minutes.
Bake in the preheated oven until the center is set, about 25 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Beat butter and 1/2 cup of brown sugar in a medium bowl until smooth. Stir in 1 1/2 cups of flour and press the mixture into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking pan. Bake until the crust is golden, about 15 minutes. Combine the remaining 1 1/2 cups of brown sugar and eggs in a separate bowl. Stir in vanilla. In another bowl, whisk together the remaining 1/4 cup flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. Fold this into the egg mixture along with coconut and walnuts. Pour this over the crust and bake until firm, around 25 to 30 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.
